intro: Sideritis grandiflora var. baetica, commonly known as the Baetica sidegrass, is a perennial herb native to the Iberian Peninsula. It features slender, upright stems that bear small, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of pale blue to purple flowers, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Its aromatic leaves and flowers have been traditionally used in herbal remedies.
